FuncDef:
The twoway-delay threshold command configures a two-way delay alarm threshold.
The undo twoway-delay threshold command cancels the two-way delay alarm threshold.
By default, the two-way delay alarm threshold is set to 100 milliseconds, and the alarm clearance threshold is 80 milliseconds.
CLIs: undo twoway-delay threshold test-session <session-id> [ upper-limit <upper-limit> lower-limit <lower-limit> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a two-way delay alarm threshold.
The value is an integer ranging from 2 to 1000, in milliseconds. The default value is 100.

Specifies a two-way delay clear alarm threshold.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 999, in milliseconds. The default value is 80.

Specifies the ID of a test session.
For the X3 device, the value is an integer ranging from 1 to 3072.For the X8/X16 device, the value is an integer ranging from 1 to 8192.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To configure the two-way delay alarm threshold, run the twoway-delay threshold command. The command output helps network administrators to adjust link bandwidth in time for service quality guarantee.
Prerequisites
A TWAMP Light test session has been created on the Control-Client.
